intro: Oxymitra hamata, commonly known as the hairy oxymitra, is a flowering plant native to parts of Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Orchidaceae, commonly known as the orchid family. The plant is characterized by its distinctive hairy leaves and small, delicate flowers that typically bloom in shades of white and yellow. It thrives in humid, tropical environments and is often found in forest undergrowth. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
